column2: long line of cases  requiring ownership of the property in  a rei vindicatio action as  a fundamental

column1: In  a rei vindicatio action the burden is on the plaintiff to establish the title pleaded and  relied on
by  him.  In  Dharmadasa v.  Jayasena 25  the grant relied  on  by the plaintiff was  held to be
and  it was  held  by the Supreme Court that therefore the  plaintiff had failed to establish title.  In
a rei vindicatio action it is  not necessary to consider whether the defendant has  any title or right
